thread.title: Edmonton Oilers tie franchise record with current nine-game win streak | SaltWire
thread.title_full: Edmonton Oilers tie franchise record with current nine-game win streak | SaltWire

author: saltwire.com
title: Edmonton Oilers tie franchise record with current nine-game win streak | SaltWire
text:
Out of the frozen frying pan and into the fire.
The Edmonton Oilers might have avoided a stretch of -30 C temperatures back home as they’ve spent the week on an Original Six road trip, but they ended up with about as much heat as they could handle in a red-hot Alex Lyon.
The Detroit Red Wings goalie came up with 44 saves Thursday in a bid to put an end to Edmonton’s eight-game win streak.
But the Oilers came from behind to pull out a 3-2 overtime victory to tie a franchise-record ninth win in a row.
It eclipses a previous high of eight wins they strung together in the end of November and early December, which ended with three losses in a row prior to going on their current streak.
That gives Edmonton a 17-3 record since U.S. Thanksgiving on Nov. 24, to push their record under new head coach Kris Knoblauch to 19-6 — an incredible rebound from the 3-9-1 start to the season under the Jay Woodcroft regime.
And it’s got them right back into the playoff race, as they improved to 22-15-1 and moved into a tie for seventh place in the Western Conference with the Nashville Predators. And for as far as they still have left to go, they’ve come a long way from being the 31st-ranked team in the league following a franchise-worst 2-9-1.
And they have given themselves a chance to set a new high watermark for the franchise as they look to make it 10 in a row for the first time, when they take on the Montreal Canadiens on Saturday (5 p.m., CBC, Sportsnet).
Thursday’s win marked the third time the Oilers have won nine games in a row, with, neither previous time coming during the dynasty days of the 1980s. The last one came down the playoff stretch a season ago, while the first nine-game streak occurred back in 2001.
